reviews.review_msg: Clearly passionate about the material, an interesting speaker, and the hottest male prof I've had yet - and not just because he's the only one under 50.
Great class, great prof, interesting material...but what was with all the photos of his wang?  It was kind of cool the first couple of times, but after that it just got weird.

I have no idea why people are complaining...I took this course after reading those terrible comments and was expecting a tough and horrible prof/course...but it's not like that at all. the notes are clear, he tells you what's going to be on the midterm and final, materials can be dry sometimes but overall interesting. I'd take his course again.
He talks way too fast. The material isn't all that interesting either. He doesn't seem interested in what he is teaching.

Excellent professor.You can tell he is really interested in the material he teaches, which makes it even better. Exams are fair, and his lecture notes are clear. One of my favourite profs in my three years at SFU.

I don't know why people are complaining. He is an AWESOME prof, who pretty much tells you what's gonna be on the midterm and final. If you go to class, and study the lecture notes, you'll do great. He's also really nice, funny, and willing to offer help if you need it. One of my favorite profs, and favorite classes of my psychology undergrad at SFU
i do not understand what he is talking about

if i were you, run away from this prof. i agree that's y professor should have a phd before they teach. he talks very  fast, n difficult to understand. this is an advice to follow if you want to maintain your gpa.
Pretty hard class, all moral/cognitive development, fast talker, but very passionate about the subject matter. Take his class if you like a challenge (some interesting concepts too)

Travis's lectures are great! If you put enough time and effort in your study, you will be satisfied with your results.  It is an advangate for us that he gives us the exam questions prior to the exam.  If you're not a slacker, I gurantee that you will not regret taking his course. Besides, the material he covers is very interesting!

Obviously enthusiastic about his topic. Maybe a little too enthusiastic...he really needs to cut down on caffeine and energy drinks. His pacing really tired me out! The course felt a bit repetitive, covering similar concepts over and over, but it was interesting.

There's a reason professors should have their phD BEFORE teaching at the 300-level... he marked NOTHING, and let the TA's (who were unavailable for any questions) mark everything. If you can, wait and take this class with Bob Ley.

RUN AWAY!!!  Travis is a TERRIBLE prof!  He talks waaay to fast, and rambles so much you never know what he is talking about.  His notes are useless (they usually lack nouns and subjects, so you don't know what topic he is talking about).  Sure, the study giudes are good, but they are very hard, and have too many questions to memorize for the test.
No Comments
Boring as heck....useless..is more like a history class then a psyc class

What a waste of time....his teaching is NOT about psyc..nothing about adolesence development.  He should teach phil. instead.  His exam were LONG and Hard! Even if he gives it ahead of time...you can't find the answers in the text or his notes.  Avoid if u can.  I did okay in that class...but is the worst class ever!

At first i thought this class was going to be extremely difficult. i was even thinking about dropping it. His midterms are easy... given that he gives the questions before... he is very organized and cute!  Travis is so smart yet so young. I look up to him. Take this course with travis!

I thought he was okay. I thought that since it was an adolescent class that he would have talked about adolescents rather than phil...but I suppose he was just talking about what he found interesting. Also the TA in the class were AWFUL!

Although he is only a sessional prof, Travis is very experienced and professional in his field. Lectures were a bit boring and he tends to ramble on and on, but it was still interesting. He gives out study questions for his tests which really helps. Make sure you follow what he wants on the essays. Over all great prof!

I took this course because I thought it was a psyc course but all he talked about for the whole semester was philosophical stuff that was soooo boring. His exams are hard eventhough he gives practice questions before hand. They are long and him and his TA's are terrible markers. He never took the effort to make sure his lectures are being recorded

He's only a PhD candidate, but Travis is the smartest prof to have ever graced SFU. He's not only passionate about the subject, he's one of the most animated and interesting speakers I've ever known. Exam questions are given before actual exam, so as long as you put effort into it, it's not hard to ace. Plus, he's SO CUTE in his sweater vests.
